title: Remove Veigar's stacks on death
body: Him getting permanent stacks to every skill from just trapping people with his stun is bad enough. Him being able to 1 hit is such a cancerous idea. Even nasus only gets stacks on his q, Veigar gets stacks on everything. SO much fuckign cancer.

This is a lie - Veigar did not "always have that passive" -- he used to have a passive much like {{item:3028}}  - where he constantly regenerated % total mana..  which made him a much better mage -imo. His could sustain his mana in lane nearly infinitely if he wanted.  Gaining his stacks with Q -  They changed it for what ever reason, (only riot knows) - to this "touch someone gain AP"  - 

I agree that his new passive makes him annoying as hell - however, it would not be so bad if his AP ratios were low - but they are not - nor is he a "glass cannon" outright, you can build him that way and execute anyone with the high skill level R push.

His Q - does between 70-230 damage + 60% total AP  (not just bonus)
His W - 100 - 300 + 100% total AP - and gets a passive 10% reduced CD per 50 stacks
His E - is about 1/3 a lane in area (have not measured exactly) 
R - 175-325+75% total AP - increased by targets % missing HP up to 100% at 33% or less. 

In my eyes - his R should be a skill shot not a point and click, (imagine if {{champion:6}} ulti always connected - did that kind of damage - and he could just kill you if he desired - people would flip) 
(So for reference Urgot R is 100-350 +50% **bonus **AD only , not total) 
                     His E should be a smaller area
                     and his ratios should be dipped to about 1/2 - or 3/4 what they are -

He would still scale well into mid/late game - he would still destroy Late late game, and he could still pretty much deal true dmg with a {{item:3135}}  later game. 

but of course I am not Riot - these are just opinions

Easy way to fix Veigar; His q can now only hit one target, its range is reduced to 600 but it becomes targeted rather than a skillshot. Increase the scaling by 20%, to reward Veigars for taking bigger risks in positioning. Slightly reduce the range on E and increase the cooldown but as compensation shorten the delay time. His ult is pretty boring, thematically. Instead of scaling off missing health, what about something like scaling off enemy AP? It would give him a nice niche and gameplay identity as an anti-mage. Increase the scaling a bit though to make it so he's not totally reliant on the enemy team. Say, 120% of his own AP plus 60% of the enemy's? His passive will have to be tuned down in this case, since his scalings are being upped. How about keep the portion where he gets AP for kills on his Q, and for takedowns, but I think he can live without stacking off his other abilities.

Thoughts?

But then he will have to spam his Q harder to make up for the lost potential, so he will have severe mana problems. Lets move his current passive to his Q since it only works for that now and give him mana regen per missing mana on his passive.
